title: Keefe Bruyette & Woods Rating Update on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA)
text:
By Shannon Hughes - Aug 5, 2015 
In a research note released to the investors, Keefe Bruyette & Woods maintains its rating on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA).The analysts at the brokerage house have a current rating of Outperform on the shares. In a recent information released to the investors, Keefe Bruyette & Woods raises the new price target from $31 per share to $33 per share. The rating by the firm was issued on July 22, 2015. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA): The mean short term price target for S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) has been established at $31.67 per share. The higher price target estimate is at $32 and the lower price target estimate is expected at $31 according to 3 Analyst. The stock price is expected to vary based on the estimate which is suggested by the standard deviation value of $0.58 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) is a hold, according to the average broker rating of 2.8. The number of analysts in this rating is 5. Experts at Zacks have given it a short term rating of 2, which means that the investors can Buy for the short term positions. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) rose 0.65% or 0.2 points on Wednesday and made its way into the gainers of the day. After trading began at $30.78 the stock was seen hitting $31.34 as a peak level and $30.69 as the lowest level. The stock ended up at $30.89. The daily volume was measured at 50,808 shares. The 52-week high of the share price is $32.88 and the 52-week low is $23.07. The company has a market cap of $1,075 million. 
S&T Bancorp Inc. is up 16.68% in the last 3-month period. Year-to-Date the stock performance stands at 5.61%. Shares of S&T Bancorp Inc. rose by 1.77% in the last five trading days and 5.5% for the last 4 weeks. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (S&T) is a bank holding company and has three wholly owned subsidiaries, S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. The Company also owns certain interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company. As of December 31, 2012, the Company had approximately $3.4 billion in loans and $3.6 billion in deposits. S&T Bank is a full service bank. It provides its services to its customers through offices located in Allegheny, Armstrong, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Clarion, Clearfield, Indiana, Jefferson and Westmoreland counties of Pennsylvania. It operates in three segments: Community Banking, Wealth Management and Insurance. Its Community Banking segment offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services. The Wealth Management segment offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds. SHARE
